009package imagingbook.common.hough;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.Collections;
013import java.util.List;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
019import imagingbook.common.util.progress.ProgressReporter;
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class implements the "classic" Hough Transform for straight lines. This
024 * implementation improves the algorithm described in the textbook in the way
025 * the accumulator is updated. Here, the quantity 1 is not added to a single
026 * accumulator cell but gets distributed over two neighboring (radial) cells to
027 * reduce aliasing effects. Thus we accumulate non-integer values and therefore
028 * the various accumulators are of type {@code float[][]}. See Sec. 12.2 of [1]
029 * for additional details.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
033 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/04/01
038 * @version 2022/09/10 removed ImageJ progress reporting
039 */
040public class HoughTransformLines implements ProgressReporter {
041        
042        // TODO: revise constructors and parameters, add bias correction
043
044        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle<HoughTransformLines> {        
045                /** Number of angular steps over [0, pi] */
046                public int nAng = 256;          
047                /** Number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction (accum. size = 2 * nRad + 1) */
048                public int nRad = 128;
049        }
050
051        private final int nAng; // number of angular steps over [0, pi]
052        private final int nRad; // number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction
053
054        private final int width, height; // size of the reference frame (image)
055        private final double xRef, yRef; // reference point (x/y-coordinate of image center)
056
057        private final double dAng; // increment of angle
058        private final double dRad; // increment of radius
059        private final int cRad; // array index representing the zero radius
060
061        private final int accWidth; // width of the accumulator array (angular direction)
062        private final int accHeight; // height of the accumulator array (radial direction)
063        private final float[][] accumulator; // accumulator array
064        private final float[][] accumulatorExt; // extended accumulator array
065        private final float[][] accumulatorMax; // accumulator, with local maxima only
066
067        private final double[] cosTable; // tabulated cosine values
068        private final double[] sinTable; // tabulated sine values
069
070        // -------------- public constructor(s) ------------------------
071
072        /**
073         * Constructor. Creates a new Hough transform from the binary image.
074         * 
075         * @param I      input image, relevant (edge) points have pixel values greater 0.
076         * @param params parameter object.
077         */
078        public HoughTransformLines(ByteProcessor I, Parameters params) {
079                this(I.getWidth(), I.getHeight(), params);
080                this.process(I, accumulator);
081        }
082        
083        public HoughTransformLines(ByteProcessor I) {
084                this(I, new Parameters());
085        }
086
087        /**
088         * Constructor. Creates a new Hough transform from a sequence of 2D points. Parameters M, N
089         * are only used to specify the reference point (usually at the center of the
090         * image). Use this constructor if the relevant image points are collected
091         * separately.
092         * 
093         * @param points an array of 2D points.
094         * @param width      width of the corresponding image plane.
095         * @param height      height of the corresponding image plane.
096         * @param params parameter object.
097         */
098        public HoughTransformLines(Pnt2d[] points, int width, int height, Parameters params) {
099                this(width, height, params);
100                this.process(points, accumulator);
101        }
102
103        // Non-public constructor used by public constructors (to initialize all final
104        // members variables).
105        private HoughTransformLines(int width, int height, Parameters params) {
106                if (params == null) 
107                        params = new Parameters();
108                this.width = width;
109                this.height = height;
110                this.xRef = width / 2; // integer value
111                this.yRef = height / 2; // integer value
112                this.nAng = params.nAng;
113                this.nRad = params.nRad;
114                this.dAng = Math.PI / nAng;
115                this.dRad = 0.5 * Math.hypot(width, height) / nRad; // nRad radial steps over half the diagonal length
116                this.cRad = nRad;
117                this.accWidth = nAng;
118                this.accHeight = nRad + 1 + nRad;
119                this.accumulator = new float[accWidth][accHeight]; // cells are initialized to zero!
120                this.accumulatorExt = new float[2 * accWidth][accHeight];
121                this.accumulatorMax = new float[accWidth][accHeight];
122                this.cosTable = makeCosTable();
123                this.sinTable = makeSinTable();
124        }
125
126        // -------------- public methods ------------------------
127
128        /**
129         * Finds and returns the parameters of the strongest lines with a specified min.
130         * pixel count. All objects in the returned array are valid, but the array may
131         * be empty. Note: Could perhaps be implemented more efficiently with
132         * insert-sort.
133         * 
134         * @param amin the minimum accumulator value for each line.
135         * @param maxLines maximum number of (strongest) lines to extract.
136         * @return a possibly empty array of {@link HoughLine} objects.
137         */
138        public HoughLine[] getLines(int amin, int maxLines) {
139                makeAccumulatorExt();   // TODO: should not be here
140                findLocalMaxima();
141                // collect all lines corresponding to accumulator maxima
142                List<HoughLine> lines = new ArrayList<>();
143                for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
144                        for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
145                                int hcount = (int) accumulatorMax[ai][ri];
146                                if (hcount >= amin) {
147                                        double angle = angleFromIndex(ai);
148                                        double radius = radiusFromIndex(ri);
149                                        lines.add(new HoughLine(angle, radius, xRef, yRef, hcount));
150                                }
151                        }
152                }
153                // sort 'lines' by count (highest counts first)
154                Collections.sort(lines);
155                List<HoughLine> slines = lines.subList(0, Math.min(maxLines, lines.size()));
156                // convert the list to an array and return:
157                return slines.toArray(new HoughLine[0]);
158        }
159        
160        /**
161         * Returns the reference points x-coordinate.
162         * @return as described.
163         */
164        public double getXref() {
165                return xRef;
166        }
167        
168        /**
169         * Returns the reference points y-coordinate.
170         * @return as described.
171         */
172        public double getYref() {
173                return yRef;
174        }
175
176        /**
177         * Calculates the actual angle (in radians) for angle index {@code ai}
178         * 
179         * @param ai angle index [0,...,nAng-1]
180         * @return Angle [0,...,PI] for angle index ai
181         */
182        public double angleFromIndex(int ai) {
183                return ai * dAng;
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * Calculates the actual radius for radius index ri.
188         * 
189         * @param ri radius index [0,...,nRad-1].
190         * @return Radius [-maxRad,...,maxRad] with respect to reference point (xc, yc).
191         */
192        public double radiusFromIndex(int ri) {
193                return (ri - cRad) * dRad;
194        }
195
196        public double radiusToIndex(double rad) {
197                return cRad + rad / dRad;
198        }
199        
200        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
201
202        /**
203         * Returns the accumulator as a 2D float-array.
204         * @return the contents of the accumulator
205         */
206        public float[][] getAccumulator() {
207                return this.accumulator;
208        }
209
210        /**
211         * Returns the local maximum values of the accumulator as a 2D float-array
212         * (all non-maximum elements are set to zero).
213         * @return the local maximum values of the accumulator 
214         */
215        public float[][] getAccumulatorMax() {
216                return this.accumulatorMax;
217        }
218        
219        /**
220         * Returns the extended accumulator as a 2D float-array.
221         * @return the extended accumulator
222         */
223        public float[][] getAccumulatorExtended() {
224                return this.accumulatorExt;
225        }
226        
227
228        /**
229         * Creates and returns an image of the 2D accumulator array.
230         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator
231         */
232        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImage() {
233                return new FloatProcessor(accumulator);
234        }
235        
236
237        /**
238         * Creates and returns an image of the extended 2D accumulator array, produced
239         * by adding a vertically mirrored copy of the accumulator to its right end. 
240         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the extended accumulator
241         */
242        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImageExtended() {
243                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(accumulatorExt);
244                return fp;
245        }
246
247        /**
248         * Creates and returns an image of the local maxima of the 2D accumulator array.
249         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator maxima
250         */
251        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorMaxImage() {
252                return new FloatProcessor(accumulatorMax);
253        }
254
255        // -------------- nonpublic methods ------------------------
256
257        private double[] makeCosTable() {
258                double[] cosTab = new double[nAng];
259                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
260                        double angle = dAng * ai;
261                        cosTab[ai] = Math.cos(angle);
262                }
263                return cosTab;
264        }
265
266        private double[] makeSinTable() {
267                double[] sinTab = new double[nAng];
268                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
269                        double angle = dAng * ai;
270                        sinTab[ai] = Math.sin(angle);
271                }
272                return sinTab;
273        }
274
275        private void process(ByteProcessor ip, float[][] acc) {
276                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
277                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
278                                if (ip.get(u, v) != 0) { // this is a foreground (edge) pixel - use ImageAccessor??
279                                        processPoint(u, v, acc);
280                                }
281                        }
282                }
283        }
284
285        private void process(Pnt2d[] points, float[][] acc) {
286                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
287                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
288                        if (p != null) {
289                                processPoint(p.getX(), p.getY(), acc);
290                        }
291                }
292        }
293
294        private void processPoint(double u, double v, float[][] acc) {
295                final double x = u - xRef;
296                final double y = v - yRef;
297                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
298//                      double theta = dAng * ai;
299//                      double r = x * Math.cos(theta) + y * Math.sin(theta);
300                        double r = x * cosTable[ai] + y * sinTable[ai]; // sin/cos tables improve speed!
301                        double ri = radiusToIndex(r);
302                        // accumulated quantity (1.0) is distributed to 2 neighboring bins:
303                        int r0 = (int) Math.floor(ri);  // lower radial bin index
304                        int r1 = r0 + 1;                                // upper radial bin index
305                        if (r0 >= 0 && r1 < accHeight) {
306                                double alpha = ri - r0;
307                                acc[ai][r0] += (1.0 - alpha);
308                                acc[ai][r1] += alpha;
309                        }
310                }
311        }
312        
313        /**
314         * Searches for local maxima in the extended accumulator but enters their
315         * positions in 'accumulatorMax'.
316         */
317        private void findLocalMaxima() {
318                for (int ai = 1; ai <= accWidth; ai++) {        // note the range!
319                        for (int ri = 1; ri < accHeight - 1; ri++) {
320                                float vC = accumulatorExt[ai][ri];      // center value
321                                boolean ismax = 
322                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri]     && // 0
323                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri - 1] && // 1
324                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri - 1] && // 2
325                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri - 1] && // 3
326                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri]     && // 4
327                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri + 1] && // 5
328                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri + 1] && // 6
329                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri + 1];   // 7
330                                if (ismax) {
331                                        if (ai < accWidth)
332                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][ri] = vC; // take care of ai == accWidth
333                                        else
334                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][accHeight - ri - 1] = vC;
335                                }
336                        }
337                }
338        }
339        
340        /**
341         * Creates the extended 2D accumulator array 
342         */
343        private void makeAccumulatorExt() {
344                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
345                        for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
346                                // insert original accumulator into the left side
347                                accumulatorExt[ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][ri];
348                                // insert a vertically flipped copy of accumulator into the right side
349                                accumulatorExt[accWidth + ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][accHeight - ri - 1];
350                        }
351                }
352        }
353
354        @Override
355        public double getProgress() {
356                // TODO report progress state
357                return 1;
358        }
359        
360}
361
362
